interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets Review Date: 2019/04/08 Categories: International, Action, Compelling, Futuristic Product Description: ['A dark force threatens Alpha, a vast metropolis and home to species from a thousand planets. Special operatives Valerian and Laureline must race to identify the marauding menace and safeguard not just Alpha, but the future of the universe.'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Luc Besson'], 'Producers': ['Fanny Besson', 'Luc Besson', 'Virginie Besson-Silla', 'Jc Cheng', 'Camille Courau', 'Mark Gao', 'Dylan Haggerty', 'Gregory Ouanhon'], 'Starring': ['Dane DeHaan', 'Cara Delevingne', 'Clive Owen']} Review Text: High production garbage.

I keep wanting to rage about this or that aspect of the movie having done horribly but it would reduce from the other ones.

It was bad all around, in so many ways. Review Title: Wish I'd not wasted my time and money watching it in theaters. Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------

John Sheppard (Joe Flanigan) right back into action, and the Atlantis team sees the return of several favorite guest stars and meets a sinister new foe.'] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert C. Cooper', 'Andy Mikita', 'Brad Turner', 'Martin Wood', 'Will Waring', 'Paul Ziller'], 'Producers': ['Brad Wright', 'Robert C. Cooper', 'Carl Binder', 'Martin Gero']} Have watched the whole series three times now. Awesome show. Awesome show. Mr. Holmes [DVD + Digital] Ian McKellen (Actor), Laura Linney (Actor), Bill Condon (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama ["Mr. Holmes is a new twist on the world’s most famous detective. In 1947, in his remote seaside farmhouse, an aging Sherlock Holmes (Ian McKellen, Academy Award (r) nominee, 2002, Best Actor in a Supporting Role, The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring) tends to his bees, with only the company of his housekeeper (Laura Linney, Academy Award (r) nominee, 2001, Best Actress in a Leading Role, You Can Count on Me) and her charming young son, Roger. Grappling with the diminishing powers of his mind, Holmes comes to rely upon the boy as he revisits the circumstances of the unsolved case that forced him into retirement, and searches for answers to the mysteries of life and love – before it's too late."] {'Genre': 'Crime', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Laura Linney, Bill Condon, Hiroyuki Sanada, Milo Parker, Jeffrey Hatcher, Ian McKellen, Mitch Cullin', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '35225428', 'Director': 'Bill Condon', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 10, 2015', 'Actors': 'Ian McKellen, Laura Linney, Milo Parker, Hiroyuki Sanada', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Mitch Cullin, Jeffrey Hatcher', 'Number of discs': '1'} The DVD makes is incredibly hard to start the movie, and once there, if you stop or turn of the movie for any reason, you can start it back up, either then or later, you have to go through all the 4 minutes of the DVD's "starting" garbage.

I stopped half way into it last night, had to restart, wasted half an hour with scene selection (having to go through the 4 minutes of "startup" in between each selection), the when I finally found the place, accidentally pressed stop instead of play, which reset the DVD for the 10th time. So I clicked eject. So I can't say how good the movie is but this DVD is horribly made.

My DVD player is perfectly capable of remembering where it left off other DVDs, even weeks later. The studio spent tons of money on the movie then apparently gave the DVD & its menus to be made by their unemployed nephew for $20. So I can't say how good the movie is but this DVD is HORRIBLY made. Arrival Drama, Science Fiction, Cerebral, Dreamlike ['When mysterious spacecraft touch down across the globe, an elite team - led by expert translator Louise Banks (Academy Award nominee Amy Adams) - races against time to decipher their intent.'] {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English (US) [CC]', 'English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['---'], 'Producers': ['Shawn Levy', 'Dan Levine', 'Aaron Ryder', 'David Linde'], 'Starring': ['Amy Adams', 'Jeremy Renner', 'Forest Whitaker']} Fantastic movie. If you loved Contact, you'll definitely like this movie too. Not the same, but the same feel. Fantastic movie. If you loved Contact Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets International, Action, Compelling, Futuristic ['A dark force threatens Alpha, a vast metropolis and home to species from a thousand planets. Special operatives Valerian and Laureline must race to identify the marauding menace and safeguard not just Alpha, but the future of the universe.'] {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Luc Besson'], 'Producers': ['Fanny Besson', 'Luc Besson', 'Virginie Besson-Silla', 'Jc Cheng', 'Camille Courau', 'Mark Gao', 'Dylan Haggerty', 'Gregory Ouanhon'], 'Starring': ['Dane DeHaan', 'Cara Delevingne', 'Clive Owen']} High production garbage.

I keep wanting to rage about this or that aspect of the movie having done horribly but it would reduce from the other ones.

It was bad all around, in so many ways. Wish I'd not wasted my time and money watching it in theaters.
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interest**: The user remains highly engaged with science fiction television and films, especially those that blend fantasy elements with intricate narratives. They continue to celebrate works that resonate with notable literary characters and philosophical themes.

- **Content Preferences**: There is a consistent preference for established franchises and enduring storylines. However, recent interactions reveal a growing discontent with films that fail to meet production standards, indicating that the user values both creativity and quality.

- **Format Preference**: The user favors DVD collections for their tangibility and production quality. They are increasingly frustrated with poorly designed DVDs, particularly those that present navigation and playback issues, reinforcing their demand for well-made, high-quality packaging.

- **Quality Appreciation**: The user has an acute awareness of production quality, reflected in their tendency to rate products based on detailed experiences rather than just overall enjoyment. A significant recent review highlighted their disappointment with a film's execution, further stressing their commitment to high-quality media.

- **Engagement with Series**: The user continues to deeply engage with multiple seasons of various series, enjoying the richness of extended narratives and frequently rewatching entire collections.

- **Rating Behavior**: Their rating behavior reflects a commitment to quality experiences; the user provides critical feedback when faced with unsatisfactory projects while maintaining high expectations for production and narrative depth.
